ygData.subject: Re: twinked? / EQ ettiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: hehee I thought I was the only one bothered by it. Yes...I find it rude if people inspect and don t ask first. That is like some stranger coming to my door and
ygData.messageBody:
hehee I thought I was the only one bothered by it. Yes...I find it rude if
people inspect and don't ask first. That is like some stranger coming to my
door and walking in and checking out my CD Collection hehe

Once they ask, I let them inspect, but if they inspect without asking, I
normally walk away out of range so they can't see anything anymore.

Lana


----Original Message Follows----
From: Selene <selene1212@...>
Reply-To: EverQuest@onelist.com
To: EverQuest@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] twinked? / EQ ettiquette
Date: Mon, 7 Feb 2000 09:41:58 -0800 (PST)



--- Lanadina the Magician <lanadina@...>
wrote:
> I'm thinking back in old school, when I first
> started playing. The FBR back
> then was the GOD robe....when the oracle robe
> was found, people nearly fell
> over themselves just to do an inspect on me <G>
>
> Lana
>

I find it kind of rude for people to be snooping
in other peoples stuff! Is 'inspect' a totally
accepted thing, or is there some sort of
ettiquette that goes along with it? I don't mind
so much if I've been chatting with someone for a
little while and they take a peek [it's not like
I have anything good to hide!] but when people
come right up to you, snoop, and then don't even
respond when you say 'Hail' , I find that
extremely annoying. Any comments, guys?

Sinarya
6th DE Necromancer
Veeshan

=====
* Selene *
